qas.question: What was one of the earliest presentations of this vocabulary?
What was said must represent usage by that administration?
Who had formed the club that contained much of the colonial administration?

context: Much of the colonial administration belonged to this club, which had been formed by the <a2_0>Duke of Wellington<a2_0/>. <a1_0>Meadows' terminology<a1_0/> must represent usage by that administration. If not the first use of the terms, <a0_0>the letter to the Times<a0_0/> was certainly one of the earliest presentations of this vocabulary to the general public. They became immediately popular, supplanting "Levant" and "East Indies," which gradually receded to minor usages and then began to change meaning.
